com.annomarket.job

Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.annomarket.common.ApiObject
      • com.annomarket.job.JobSummary
        • com.annomarket.job.Job

  • public class Job
extends JobSummary
    Full details of an annotation job, and methods to configure and control the job. Note that while many of the fields on this object are public, direct modifications to the field values will not be reflected in the server-side state - use the manipulation methods to modify the job on the server.
    Author:
    Ian Roberts

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      long bytesCharged
      Number of bytes of data processing that has so far been charged to your account for this job.
      long bytesUsed
      Number of bytes of data processed so far by this job.

      Date the job completed execution, in the form of Date.toString(), or null if the job has not yet been run.

      Date the job was created, in the form of Date.toString().
      long id
      The job's numeric identifier.
      String name
      The name of the job.
      Prices price
      The prices that will be charged when running this job.
      double progress
      Number between 0 and 1 giving the proportion of the job's tasks that have so far been completed, or less than 0 if the number of sub-tasks has not yet been determined.
      String resultsAvailableUntil
      Date when the results of the completed job will expire and be deleted from temporary storage.
      long timeCharged
      Processing time that has been charged so far for this job.
      long timeUsed
      Processing time consumed so far by this job, measured in milliseconds.
      String uuid
      Internal unique identifier for the job, used for example in temporary file names.

    • Field Detail

      • id

        public long id
        The job's numeric identifier.

      • name

        public String name
        The name of the job.

      • uuid

        public String uuid
        Internal unique identifier for the job, used for example in temporary file names.

      • price

        public Prices price
        The prices that will be charged when running this job.

      • dateCreated

        public String dateCreated
        Date the job was created, in the form of Date.toString().

      • dateCompleted

        public String dateCompleted
        Date the job completed execution, in the form of Date.toString(), or null if the job has not yet been run.

      • resultsAvailableUntil

        public String resultsAvailableUntil
        Date when the results of the completed job will expire and be deleted from temporary storage. If your job has not been configured to store its results directly in your own S3 bucket then you must download them before this time or they will be lost. This field will be null if the job has not yet been run.

      • timeUsed

        public long timeUsed
        Processing time consumed so far by this job, measured in milliseconds.

      • timeCharged

        public long timeCharged
        Processing time that has been charged so far for this job. Measured in milliseconds but the value will always be a multiple of one hour (3600000 ms) and may be more than timeUsed as charges are rounded up to whole hours.

      • bytesUsed

        public long bytesUsed
        Number of bytes of data processed so far by this job.

      • bytesCharged

        public long bytesCharged
        Number of bytes of data processing that has so far been charged to your account for this job.

      • progress

        public double progress
        Number between 0 and 1 giving the proportion of the job's tasks that have so far been completed, or less than 0 if the number of sub-tasks has not yet been determined.

        public Job()

    • Method Detail

      • rename

        public void rename(String newName)
        Change the name of this job.
        Parameters:
        newName - the new name

      • outputToS3

        public void outputToS3(String location,
              String accessKeyId,
              String secretKey)
        Configure this job to send its output files directly to an S3 bucket that is not owned by AnnoMarket.
        Parameters:
        location - a "URL" of the form s3://bucketname/keyprefix/ denoting the target bucket and prefix to prepend to key values when storing objects in the bucket
        accessKeyId - an AWS access key ID (typically a limited IAM user) with permission to put objects in the specified bucket with keys starting with the specified prefix
        secretKey - the corresponding AWS secret key.

      • outputToDefault

        public void outputToDefault()
        Configure this job to use the default behaviour of saving its output in an AnnoMarket-owned location accessible via results(). This call can be used to countermand an earlier outputToS3(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).

      • listInputs

        public List<InputSummary> listInputs()
        List all the input specifications configured for this job.
        Returns:
        one InputSummary object per input specification

      • addArchiveInput

        public InputDetails addArchiveInput(File inputFile,
                           InputType inputType,
                           String encoding,
                           String mimeTypeOverride,
                           String fileExtensions)
        Upload a local "archive" file (zip, tar{.gz|.bz2}, or a Twitter search result or stream of Tweets) as input to this job.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - the local file to upload
        inputType - the type of the input
        encoding - character encoding to use when reading entries from the archive. If null, UTF-8 will be used. Should be left as null for Twitter input types.
        mimeTypeOverride - the MIME type to use when parsing entries from the archive. If null the appropriate type will be guessed based on the file name extension. Should be left as null for Twitter input types.
        fileExtensions - comma-separated list of file extensions that will be processed. Entries that do not match any of these extensions will be ignored. If null all entries that represent files (as opposed to directories) will be processed. Should be left as null for Twitter input types.
        Returns:
        details of the newly-created input specification.

      • addArchiveInput

        public InputDetails addArchiveInput(String s3Location,
                           String accessKeyId,
                           String secretKey,
                           InputType inputType,
                           String encoding,
                           String mimeTypeOverride,
                           String fileExtensions)
        Point to an "archive" file (zip, tar{.gz|.bz2}, or a Twitter search result or stream of Tweets) on Amazon S3 as input to this job.
        Parameters:
        s3Location - a "URL" of the form s3://bucketname/key denoting the target object in Amazon S3
        accessKeyId - an AWS access key ID (typically a limited IAM user) with permission to get the specified object
        secretKey - the corresponding AWS secret key.
        inputType - the type of the input
        encoding - character encoding to use when reading entries from the archive. If null, UTF-8 will be used. Should be left as null for Twitter input types.
        mimeTypeOverride - the MIME type to use when parsing entries from the archive. If null the appropriate type will be guessed based on the file name extension. Should be left as null for Twitter input types.
        fileExtensions - comma-separated list of file extensions that will be processed. Entries that do not match any of these extensions will be ignored. If null all entries that represent files (as opposed to directories) will be processed. Should be left as null for Twitter input types.
        Returns:
        details of the newly-created input specification.

      • addARCInput

        public InputDetails addARCInput(File inputFile,
                       String encoding,
                       String mimeTypeOverride,
                       String mimeTypes)
        Upload a local Internet Archive ARC file as input to this job.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - the local file to upload
        inputType - the type of the input
        encoding - character encoding to use when reading entries from the archive. If null, the ARC entry headers will be used to guess an appropriate encoding for each entry.
        mimeTypeOverride - the MIME type to use when parsing entries from the archive. If null the appropriate type will be guessed based on the file name extension and HTTP headers from the ARC entry.
        mimeTypes - space-separated list of MIME types used to filter the entries of interest from the ARC file. Entries whose MIME type does not match any of these will be ignored.
        Returns:
        details of the newly-created input specification.

      • addARCInput

        public InputDetails addARCInput(String s3Location,
                       String accessKeyId,
                       String secretKey,
                       String encoding,
                       String mimeTypeOverride,
                       String mimeTypes)
        Point to an Internet Archive ARC file on Amazon S3 as input to this job.
        Parameters:
        s3Location - a "URL" of the form s3://bucketname/key denoting the target object in Amazon S3
        accessKeyId - an AWS access key ID (typically a limited IAM user) with permission to get the specified object
        secretKey - the corresponding AWS secret key.
        inputType - the type of the input
        encoding - character encoding to use when reading entries from the archive. If null, the ARC entry headers will be used to guess an appropriate encoding for each entry.
        mimeTypeOverride - the MIME type to use when parsing entries from the archive. If null the appropriate type will be guessed based on the file name extension and HTTP headers from the ARC entry.
        mimeTypes - space-separated list of MIME types used to filter the entries of interest from the ARC file. Entries whose MIME type does not match any of these will be ignored.
        Returns:
        details of the newly-created input specification.

      • addUploadInput

        protected InputDetails addUploadInput(File inputFile,
                          InputType inputType,
                          String encoding,
                          String mimeTypeOverride,
                          String fileExtensions,
                          String mimeTypes)
        Common implementation for all upload-based inputs.

      • addS3Input

        protected InputDetails addS3Input(String s3Location,
                      String accessKeyId,
                      String secretKey,
                      InputType inputType,
                      String encoding,
                      String mimeTypeOverride,
                      String fileExtensions,
                      String mimeTypes)
        Common implementation for all S3-based inputs.

      • addCommonCrawlInput

        public InputDetails addCommonCrawlInput(String protocol,
                               String hostName,
                               String pathPrefix)
        Define an input specification for this job based on a search of the Common Crawl corpus.
        Parameters:
        protocol - either "http" or "https". If null, pages for both protocols will be included.
        hostName - a pattern representing the host name(s) to be selected from the crawl. This is allowed to contain at most one "*" character, which, if present, must be placed exactly before the first ".". The pattern must contain at least two specified inter-dot segments (e.g. "*.com" is not permitted as it would match too many entries).
        pathPrefix - a pattern which may contain "*" characters that is matched against the path part of the URL for the crawled items. Only crawled items for which the path starts as specified will be returned. If null , all items that match the hostname will be returned.
        Returns:
        details of the newly-created input specification.

      • listOutputs

        public List<Output> listOutputs()
        List all the output specifications for this job.
        Returns:
        one Output object per output specification

      • addMimirOutput

        public Output addMimirOutput(String indexUrl,
                    String username,
                    String password)
        Add an output specification for this job that pushes results into a Mímir index.
        Parameters:
        indexUrl - URL of the target index
        username - username used to authenticate to the index. If null authentication is not used.
        password - the corresponding password (should be null if and only if username is null)
        Returns:
        details of the newly-created output specification.

      • addFileOutput

        public Output addFileOutput(OutputType type,
                   String fileExtension,
                   String annotationSelectors)
        Add an output specification for this job that saves results in files (which will be packaged up and delivered as ZIP archives) in one of a number of formats.
        Parameters:
        type - output type
        fileExtension - the extension to append to the generated file names (e.g. ".GATE.xml"). This should be different for each output specification.
        annotationSelectors - comma-separated list of annotation selector expressions.
        Returns:
        details of the newly-created output specification.

      • control

        protected void control(String action)
        Common implementation for job control actions.

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the execution of this job. The job must be in the READY state or this operation will fail.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the execution of this job. The job must be in the RUNNING state or this operation will fail.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resume execution of this job after it was suspended due to lack of funds. The job must be in the SUSPENDED state or this operation will fail.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset this job so it can be re-run. The job must be in the COMPLETED state or this operation will fail.

      • executionLog

        public List<LogMessage> executionLog(Calendar from,
                            Calendar to)
        Fetch execution log messages for this job. The from and to parameters allow you to restrict to log entries within a specific window of time - either or both of these parameters may be null.
        Parameters:
        from - earliest time stamp for log events to retrieve.
        to - latest time stamp for log events to retrieve.
        Returns:
        log messages within the specified range

      • results

        public List<JobResult> results()
        Retrieve all the result files produced by this job.
        Returns:
        a list of results, call urlToDownload on each result to get a (time-limited) URL from which the file can be downloaded.

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
        Refresh this job's data from the server to update things like the progress counter.

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Delete this job, which also deletes any output files that are stored in the default AnnoMarket-managed location.
